conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Inlet A is marked light blue, inlet B is marked orange, and inlet C is marked green.
Container D is white, and container E is black.
Stream A flows downward and encounters a blue baffle.

premise: Stream A flows downward and encounters a blue baffle.
conclusion: Stream A is deflected to the left by the blue baffle.

premise: Stream A is deflected to the left by the blue baffle.
conclusion: Stream A flows into container D.
Stream B flows downward and encounters a black baffle.

premise: Stream B flows downward and encounters a black baffle.
conclusion: Stream B is deflected to the right by the black baffle.

premise: Stream B is deflected to the right by the black baffle.
conclusion: Stream B flows into container E.
Stream C flows downward without encountering any baffles.

premise: Stream C flows downward without encountering any baffles.
conclusion: Stream C flows straight into container E.

premise: Stream A flows into container D, and streams B and C flow into container E.
conclusion: Container D receives the light blue liquid from A, and container E receives the orange liquid from B and the green liquid from C.
